intro: Scleranthus brachycarpus, commonly known as the short-fruited thornweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and legume fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, straight pods that contain its seeds. Scleranthus brachycarpus is a hardy species that can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
